oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wessyngton, the residence of the Washington Family of Robertson County, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This photograph features the main house, lived in by the Washington family, at Wessyngton Plantation.

One of the largest tobacco plantations of the South, Wessyngton was the estate of the Washington family, one of the state's largest slave owners. In 1860, the family owned 13,000 acres and 274 slaves.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Slavery; Wessyngton Plantation (Tenn.); Tobacco farms; Plantation life--Southern States--History
Tobacco plantations
